meanings.definition: The process of cementing or binding together.
meanings.sent1: The cementation of the bricks held the wall strong.
meanings.sent2: The cementation of the friendship between the two children was evident in their constant laughter.
meanings.sent3: The cementation of the puzzle pieces made it impossible for the siblings to cheat.
meanings.sent4: The cementation of their ideas created a solid foundation for the project.
meanings.sent5: The cementation of the ingredients in the recipe ensured a delicious outcome.

meanings.definition: The act of treating with cement or mortar.
meanings.sent1: After the cementation of the broken vase, it looked good as new.
meanings.sent2: The cementation of the cracks in the sidewalk prevented accidents.
meanings.sent3: The cementation of the cookies with frosting made them irresistible to the kids.
meanings.sent4: The cementation of the relationship between the neighbors brought peace to the community.
meanings.sent5: The cementation of the pieces in the art project required precision and patience.

meanings.definition: The process of hardening or solidifying.
meanings.sent1: The cementation of the ice on the pond made it safe for skating.
meanings.sent2: The cementation of the mud in the yard turned it into a solid surface.
meanings.sent3: The cementation of the jello in the mold amused the children as they wiggled it out.
meanings.sent4: The cementation of the lava flow created new land formations.
meanings.sent5: The cementation of the sandcastle made it stand strong against the waves.
